intro: Lettsomia pinangiana var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate lettsomia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive reticulated leaf patterns and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
